title: Shock
data:
In NetHack, various types of electrical attacks deal **shock** damage:

- Zapped or broken [wand of lightning](/wiki/Wand_of_lightning "Wand of lightning")
- [Mjollnir](/wiki/Mjollnir "Mjollnir")'s lightning strike bonus
- [Melee](/wiki/Melee "Melee") attacks of [grid bugs](/wiki/Grid_bug "Grid bug") and [electric eels](/wiki/Electric_eel "Electric eel")
- [Explosion](/wiki/Explosion "Explosion") attack of [shocking spheres](/wiki/Shocking_sphere "Shocking sphere")
- [Engulfing](/wiki/Engulf "Engulf") and [passive attacks](/wiki/Passive_attack "Passive attack") of [energy vortices](/wiki/Energy_vortex "Energy vortex")
- Lightning breath of [blue dragons](/wiki/Blue_dragon "Blue dragon") and the [Chromatic Dragon](/wiki/Chromatic_Dragon "Chromatic Dragon")
- The [lightning](/wiki/Lightning_\(monster_spell\) "Lightning (monster spell)") [monster spell](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell")
- Lightning bolt sent by a god through an altar in a [temple](/wiki/Temple "Temple"), against a hero who attacks the attendant [priest](/wiki/Aligned_priest "Aligned priest")
- Lightning from [divine wrath](/wiki/Anger#Smiting "Anger")
- Lightning strikes in the [clouds](/wiki/Cloudy_area "Cloudy area") on the [Plane of Air](/wiki/Plane_of_Air "Plane of Air")
- Surges of electricity from [container traps](/wiki/Container_trap "Container trap")
- Electric shocks from sitting on a [throne](/wiki/Throne "Throne")

[Ray](/wiki/Ray "Ray") attacks that deal shock damage are lightning. For example, the game will say that a blue dragon "breathes lightning". However, not all attacks described as 'lightning' are rays. For example, an angry deity may [smite](/wiki/Smite "Smite") you with "lightning", but this is a localized attack that targets the hero, not a directional ray. These types of lightning may be blocked by [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection"), like a ray, but since they are non-directional they cannot be redirected to hit other monsters, unless there is a monster [engulfing](/wiki/Engulf "Engulf") the hero.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Effects](#Effects)

  - [1.1 Rings and wands](#Rings_and_wands)
  - [1.2 Status afflictions](#Status_afflictions)

- [2 Shock protection](#Shock_protection)

- [3 System shock](#System_shock)

- [4 Variants](#Variants)

  - [4.1 dNethack](#dNethack)
  - [4.2 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)

## Effects

### Rings and wands

In addition to lowering hit points, most shock attacks have a chance of destroying [rings](/wiki/Ring "Ring") and [wands](/wiki/Wand "Wand") carried in your open inventory. Rings and wands will not be destroyed if they are stored inside a container.

The [ring of shock resistance](/wiki/Ring_of_shock_resistance "Ring of shock resistance") and [wand of lightning](/wiki/Wand_of_lightning "Wand of lightning"), as items that are specially linked to lightning, are immune to shock damage, and can be kept in open inventory without being destroyed by shock attacks.

The only item-destroying shock attacks that aren't blocked by [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection") are those from electric eels, container traps, Mjollnir, and unusually high-level grid bugs. None of these is common so they can usually be avoided, so you don't need to keep backup rings if you're careful (but it still never hurts).

### Status afflictions

Most attacks described as "lightning" are accompanied by a flash of light that [blinds](/wiki/Blind "Blind") the player when they hit. This happens even if the lightning bolt is reflected.

Lightning strikes from the clouds on the [Plane of Air](/wiki/Plane_of_Air "Plane of Air") also cause [deafness](/wiki/Deafness "Deafness") and [paralysis](/wiki/Paralysis "Paralysis").

## Shock protection

Damage to yourself or your inventory can be prevented or minimized by the following:

- **Resistance**: Intrinsic or extrinsic [shock resistance](/wiki/Shock_resistance "Shock resistance") prevents or reduces hit point loss from shock attacks. It does not prevent blindness from lightning flashes or prevect wands and rings from being destroyed.
- **Reflection**: Many shock attacks described as lightning, including lightning rays, can be [reflected](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection") away, preventing damage to yourself and your items. Reflection will not prevent blindness, however.
- **Magic cancellation**: High [MC](/wiki/MC "MC") can protect your inventory from melee shock attacks. It does not prevent damage from passive or engulfing shock attacks, or from lightning. Nor does it prevent blindness.
- **Blindness**: Being already blinded by a [blindfold](/wiki/Blindfold "Blindfold") or [towel](/wiki/Towel "Towel"), or a self-applied [cream pie](/wiki/Cream_pie "Cream pie") or [expensive camera](/wiki/Expensive_camera "Expensive camera"), will prevent the longer-lived blindness caused by lightning. You may prefer to let yourself be blinded, though, if you have one or more reliable cures available, or if you have [telepathy](/wiki/Telepathy "Telepathy").

## System shock

- *Main article: [System shock](/wiki/System_shock "System shock")*

[Polymorphing](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") has a chance of damaging or even destroying targets, including the player. This effect is called "system shock", but it is not related to shock damage and is not prevented by shock resistance.

## Variants

### dNethack

In dNethack, shock damage can no longer destroy rings. It can still affect wands, either causing them to lose a charge or destroying them entirely. Wands in your inventory which are affected will shoot sparks, further damaging you in proportion to the number of charges lost (1d6 for each).

### SLASH'EM

The following new [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") [monsters](/wiki/Monster_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Monster (SLASH'EM)") have shocking attacks: [static blobs](/wiki/Static_blob "Static blob"), [spark bugs](/wiki/Spark_bug "Spark bug"), [arc bugs](/wiki/Arc_bug "Arc bug"), [lightning bugs](/wiki/Lightning_bug "Lightning bug"), [sapphire golems](/wiki/Sapphire_golem "Sapphire golem"), and [crystal golems](/wiki/Crystal_golem "Crystal golem").

SLASH'EM also includes a new [lightning](/wiki/Spellbook_of_lightning "Spellbook of lightning") spell that the player can learn.

[![This article may require revision for the next version of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/b/b0/Nh343-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article may require revision for the next version of NetHack. Click here for more information.")

**This page may need to be updated for the [current version](/wiki/Current_version "Current version") of *NetHack*.**

It may contain text specific to [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3"). Information on this page may be out of date.

**Editors:** After reviewing this page and making necessary edits, please change the {{nethack-343}} tag to the current version's tag or {{noversion}} as appropriate.
html:
Shock

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

In NetHack, various types of electrical attacks deal shock damage:

  • Zapped or broken wand of lightning
  • Mjollnir's lightning strike bonus
  • Melee attacks of grid bugs and electric eels
  • Explosion attack of shocking spheres
  • Engulfing and passive attacks of energy vortices
  • Lightning breath of blue dragons and the Chromatic Dragon
  • The lightning monster spell
  • Lightning bolt sent by a god through an altar in a temple, against a hero who attacks the attendant priest
  • Lightning from divine wrath
  • Lightning strikes in the clouds on the Plane of Air
  • Surges of electricity from container traps
  • Electric shocks from sitting on a throne

Ray attacks that deal shock damage are lightning. For example, the game will say that a blue dragon "breathes lightning". However, not all attacks described as 'lightning' are rays. For example, an angry deity may smite you with "lightning", but this is a localized attack that targets the hero, not a directional ray. These types of lightning may be blocked by reflection, like a ray, but since they are non-directional they cannot be redirected to hit other monsters, unless there is a monster engulfing the hero.

Contents

  • 1 Effects
    • 1.1 Rings and wands
    • 1.2 Status afflictions
  • 2 Shock protection
  • 3 System shock
  • 4 Variants
    • 4.1 dNethack
    • 4.2 SLASH'EM

Effects

Rings and wands

In addition to lowering hit points, most shock attacks have a chance of destroying rings and wands carried in your open inventory. Rings and wands will not be destroyed if they are stored inside a container.

The ring of shock resistance and wand of lightning, as items that are specially linked to lightning, are immune to shock damage, and can be kept in open inventory without being destroyed by shock attacks.

The only item-destroying shock attacks that aren't blocked by reflection are those from electric eels, container traps, Mjollnir, and unusually high-level grid bugs. None of these is common so they can usually be avoided, so you don't need to keep backup rings if you're careful (but it still never hurts).

Status afflictions

Most attacks described as "lightning" are accompanied by a flash of light that blinds the player when they hit. This happens even if the lightning bolt is reflected.

Lightning strikes from the clouds on the Plane of Air also cause deafness and paralysis.

Shock protection

Damage to yourself or your inventory can be prevented or minimized by the following:

  • Resistance: Intrinsic or extrinsic shock resistance prevents or reduces hit point loss from shock attacks. It does not prevent blindness from lightning flashes or prevect wands and rings from being destroyed.
  • Reflection: Many shock attacks described as lightning, including lightning rays, can be reflected away, preventing damage to yourself and your items. Reflection will not prevent blindness, however.
  • Magic cancellation: High MC can protect your inventory from melee shock attacks. It does not prevent damage from passive or engulfing shock attacks, or from lightning. Nor does it prevent blindness.
  • Blindness: Being already blinded by a blindfold or towel, or a self-applied cream pie or expensive camera, will prevent the longer-lived blindness caused by lightning. You may prefer to let yourself be blinded, though, if you have one or more reliable cures available, or if you have telepathy.

System shock

Main article: System shock

Polymorphing has a chance of damaging or even destroying targets, including the player. This effect is called "system shock", but it is not related to shock damage and is not prevented by shock resistance.

Variants

dNethack

In dNethack, shock damage can no longer destroy rings. It can still affect wands, either causing them to lose a charge or destroying them entirely. Wands in your inventory which are affected will shoot sparks, further damaging you in proportion to the number of charges lost (1d6 for each).

SLASH'EM

The following new SLASH'EM monsters have shocking attacks: static blobs, spark bugs, arc bugs, lightning bugs, sapphire golems, and crystal golems.

SLASH'EM also includes a new lightning spell that the player can learn.


This page may need to be updated for the current version of NetHack.

It may contain text specific to NetHack 3.4.3. Information on this page may be out of date.

Editors: After reviewing this page and making necessary edits, please change the {{nethack-343}} tag to the current version's tag or {{noversion}} as appropriate.

rawPage:
In NetHack, various types of electrical attacks deal '''shock''' damage:

* Zapped or broken [[wand of lightning]]
* [[Mjollnir]]'s lightning strike bonus
* [[Melee]] attacks of [[grid bug]]s and [[electric eel]]s
* [[Explosion]] attack of [[shocking sphere]]s
* [[Engulf]]ing and [[passive attack]]s of [[energy vortex|energy vortices]]
* Lightning breath of [[blue dragon]]s and the [[Chromatic Dragon]]
* The [[Lightning (monster spell)|lightning]] [[monster spell]]
* Lightning bolt sent by a god through an altar in a [[temple]], against a hero who attacks the attendant [[Aligned priest|priest]]
* Lightning from [[Anger#Smiting|divine wrath]]
* Lightning strikes in the [[Cloudy area|clouds]] on the [[Plane of Air]]
* Surges of electricity from [[container trap]]s
* Electric shocks from sitting on a [[throne]]

[[Ray]] attacks that deal shock damage are lightning.  For example, the game will say that a blue dragon "breathes lightning".  However, not all attacks described as 'lightning' are rays.  For example, an angry deity may [[smite]] you with "lightning", but this is a localized attack that targets the hero, not a directional ray.  These types of lightning may be blocked by [[reflection]], like a ray, but since they are non-directional they cannot be redirected to hit other monsters, unless there is a monster [[engulf]]ing the hero.

==Effects==
===Rings and wands===
In addition to lowering hit points, most shock attacks have a chance of destroying [[ring]]s and [[wand]]s carried in your open inventory.  Rings and wands will not be destroyed if they are stored inside a container.

The [[ring of shock resistance]] and [[wand of lightning]], as items that are specially linked to lightning, are immune to shock damage, and can be kept in open inventory without being destroyed by shock attacks.

The only item-destroying shock attacks that aren't blocked by [[reflection]] are those from electric eels, container traps, Mjollnir, and unusually high-level grid bugs.  None of these is common so they can usually be avoided, so you don't need to keep backup rings if you're careful (but it still never hurts).

===Status afflictions===
Most attacks described as "lightning" are accompanied by a flash of light that [[blind]]s the player when they hit.  This happens even if the lightning bolt is reflected.

Lightning strikes from the clouds on the [[Plane of Air]] also cause [[deafness]] and [[paralysis]].

==Shock protection==
Damage to yourself or your inventory can be prevented or minimized by the following:

* '''Resistance''': Intrinsic or extrinsic [[shock resistance]] prevents or reduces hit point loss from shock attacks.  It does not prevent blindness from lightning flashes or prevect wands and rings from being destroyed.
* '''Reflection''': Many shock attacks described as lightning, including lightning rays, can be [[Reflection|reflected]] away, preventing damage to yourself and your items.  Reflection will not prevent blindness, however.
* '''Magic cancellation''': High [[MC]] can protect your inventory from melee shock attacks.  It does not prevent damage from passive or engulfing shock attacks, or from lightning.  Nor does it prevent blindness.
* '''Blindness''': Being already blinded by a [[blindfold]] or [[towel]], or a self-applied [[cream pie]] or [[expensive camera]], will prevent the longer-lived blindness caused by lightning.  You may prefer to let yourself be blinded, though, if you have one or more reliable cures available, or if you have [[telepathy]].

==System shock==
{{main|System shock}}
[[Polymorph]]ing has a chance of damaging or even destroying targets, including the player.  This effect is called "system shock", but it is not related to shock damage and is not prevented by shock resistance.

==Variants==
===dNethack===
In dNethack, shock damage can no longer destroy rings. It can still affect wands, either causing them to lose a charge or destroying them entirely. Wands in your inventory which are affected will shoot sparks, further damaging you in proportion to the number of charges lost (1d6 for each).

===SLASH'EM===

The following new [[SLASH'EM]] [[monster (SLASH'EM)|monsters]] have shocking attacks: [[static blob]]s, [[spark bug]]s, [[arc bug]]s, [[lightning bug]]s, [[sapphire golem]]s, and [[crystal golem]]s.  

SLASH'EM also includes a new [[spellbook of lightning|lightning]] spell that the player can learn.

{{nethack-343}}
